body.name: Ophanie Living Room Rugs 5x8 Grey, Fluffy Shag Fuzzy Plush Soft Throw Area Rug, Gray Large Shaggy Floor Big Carpets for Bedroom, Kids Home Decor Aesthetic, Nursery
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 22 hrs 29 mins

climatePledgeFriendly.details: OEKO-TEX STANDARD 100 requires textiles-based products to be tested against a list of 1,000+ chemicals, to limit those which may be harmful to human health. Certification focus: #ProductSafety and #ChemicalsUsed.

features: Ultra soft & Non-slip — Feature a shaggy carpet surface, the Ophanie soft area rug is incredibly soft with a high-density sponge interlayer. No more shedding and an upgraded non-slip bottom — The high-density small and durable anti-slip dots at the bottom enhance friction to prevent it from sliding. No need for an additional pad underneath.

The style that works — This rug is perfect for that overlaid rug look, an essential design component of hygge (that’s what the Danish call that warm and cozy feeling. The full definition of hygge is: a coziness and comfortable conviviality that engenders a feeling of contentment or well-being.) Designers agree that layering rugs work best in rooms without a lot of furniture. Try mixing a solid-colored rug like this one with a lower-pile, patterned rug.

Safe materials — This extremely soft, velvety carpet is made from polyester material. Feel free to relax on the carpet! They are great for barefoot walking and perfect for tummy time for babies. The rugs are kid and pet-friendly!

Modern design — The Ophanie area rug is designed with a luxurious feeling, soft to the touch, warm and beautiful, and skin-friendly. Each rug with a simple design in a solid color turns your room into an inviting space. This shaggy area rug with beautiful colors is an ideal choice for home decoration. It's perfect for the living room, bedroom, nursery, children's room, girl's room, baby's room, playroom.

Elevate your student's dorm room — Going to college is a huge transition. These rugs can provide a soft place to land in your student's home away from home. If he or she needs something to add a little comfort, these rugs come in just the right sizes to be the perfect addition to any dorm room — and are easy on the pocketbook, making them perfect for a college student’s budget!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great rug, reasonably priced, definitely worth it.
reviews.reviewText: Love the color, the length of the shag is perfect, it’s definitely thick enough to last and feels great on bare feet. It came vacuum sealed with no funny smells and opened right up without any creases or folds…I plan on buying another one for the bedroom. Definitely worth it 👍

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The perfect touch for my toddlers bedroom.
reviews.reviewText: I recently added the Ophanie Light Pink Area Rug to my daughter's bedroom, and it's become an instant favorite. The soft pastel hue adds a dreamy and feminine touch to the room, creating a cozy and inviting atmosphere.The rug's quality is impressive – it's plush and comfortable underfoot, providing a warm surface for playtime or stepping out of bed in the morning. The size is perfect for a bedroom, adding just the right amount of coverage without overwhelming the space.What sets this rug apart is its versatility. The light pink shade complements various decor styles, and the simple yet stylish design effortlessly ties the room together. The anti-slip backing ensures it stays securely in place, offering both safety and convenience.Cleaning is a breeze; a quick vacuuming keeps it looking fresh and vibrant. The durability has surprised me positively, holding up well even in high-traffic areas.If you're looking to add a touch of charm to a girls' bedroom, the Ophanie Light Pink Area Rug is a fantastic choice. It's a delightful addition that brings comfort and style seamlessly into the space. 🎀✨🤍

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good or bad depends on what you expect
reviews.reviewText: There are good things about this rug. It lays flat right away even though it comes vacuum sealed. It is odorless, very soft, and grips the wood floor well. Negatives? it is quite thin. The fabric feels weird, like the first time i stepped on it barefoot, I thought I had stepped on my little dog and almost did a back flip! When i stepped on it with socks, I slipped. It wasn't the grip on the bottom at fault, it was the softness and odd texture of the fabric. Be careful! I thought about tossing it in the washer to see if that would get rid of the slippery texture, but it says to spot wash only, so I guess I won't.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Machine washable and easy with animals
reviews.reviewText: This rug is so soft. My dogs and cats love to lay on it and it's so easily machine washable for animal accidents. I just wash and hang on the line and within a couple days I can lay it back down again. Very nice and expensive rug.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect For Casual Use If You Know What To Expect.
reviews.reviewText: I was nervous about ordering a rug off of amazon due to all the reviews of rugs being "slippery" Or "thin". but my expectations were blown away with this product! I have a queen size bed frame and the 5x7 rug aligns perfectly in my bedroom without taking too much space or getting in the way. it is also thin enough so that my gaming chair doesn't get caught on it when i move it which was a big concern. the material is really soft and is addicting to lay on, comfortable for an adult. the only problem i had is that it has a really strong chemical smell upon me opening it but i managed to alleviate it with a couple of sprays of lavender febreze.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I recently purchased the Ophanie Living Room Rug in the 5x8 Grey size and found it to be a mix of positives and negatives. On the upside, the rug's comfort is undeniable. Its ultra-soft, shaggy surface and high-density sponge interlayer provide a cozy and pleasant feel underfoot, making it ideal for rooms where comfort is key, like living rooms or nurseries.However, the rug falls short in durability, particularly with the non-slip pad at the bottom. Despite its initial effectiveness, the pad wears out quickly, leading to the rug bunching up, which can be a hassle to constantly adjust. Given its affordable price, I would still recommend this rug for those looking for comfort on a budget, but be aware of the potential longevity issues.Overall, I'd rate the Ophanie Living Room Rug 3 stars. It excels in providing a cozy feel to any room but may require additional maintenance or even a replacement pad over time due to wear and tear.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Inexpensive, great on the feet and a nightmare to clean.
reviews.reviewText: Side note: Do not buy black if you have a black rabbit. The little guy will disappear when he or she walks onto it. Blends right in. Next time I'm buying a different color...rug :)Good? Soft on the feet and inexpensive. Durable.Bad? dust magnet. Like you could cut the rug up into strips and use it to dust. I have to take it outside, put on goggles, a dust mask and smack it with a broom. Don't be downwind. Actually not being downwind while smacking a rug is generally good advice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great, will be purchasing extras. In the photos this is the rug when it needs to be cleaned!
reviews.reviewText: I have 2 large dogs and a muddy yard so I needed a rug thats easy to clean and cushioned enough for the dogs and occasionally toddlers. But I got tired of spending $150+ every few months for a new rug and pad. Yes I've tried carpet cleaners but just doesn't get clean enough for me.This rug (6x9) is easy to shake out. It vacuums well. I've had large and small accidents so far, small urine spot, then mystery liquid accident prior to my dog having her puppies. I just scrubbed the faux fur with a wet sponge and dawn, soaked up the soapy water with paper towels, sprayed with Lysol, fluffed the fur back up and let it dry. Looked totally normal once dry and no smell.This rug has a little cushion, not much, but enough to not feel like you're sitting on bare floor. It has a skid resistant backing which works fine. If the dogs are playing aggressively then it gets ruffled up but not a big deal. The backing keeps the liquid from spills from getting to the floor. Anytime I've had an accident you could not even see the liquid outline on the pad underneath. And tbh I didn't always know when they happened.I'm very happy with the purchase overall. Got a smaller rug for my son's room for a Christmas present and he loves it. Only negative thing I can really say is the color of the rug is significantly lighter than the one shown online. My house is not the pinnacle of interior design so I didn't mind. However, I do wish I could get the actual color pictured because the darker color would mask dirt better but the ease of cleaning makes me clean it more often, which is a great thing all around. Oh yeah, and these rugs are cheap. Cheap enough that I won't be mad replacing this rug with the same one after my litter of puppies is gone. And the rug for my son's room was only $20, so I can realistically make him pay for a new if he messes his up😂💯
Creí q era un poco más acochonada y no
